thread.title: David Pollack says he wants to be a coach in a few years
thread.title_full: David Pollack says he wants to be a coach in a few years

title: David Pollack says he wants to be a coach in a few years
text:
Manage David Pollack says he wants to be a coach in a few years ESPN college football analyst David Pollack is a former Georgia standout who saw his NFL career cut short because of injuries. While he has clearly carved out a Slot to Georgia Links 
ESPN college football analyst David Pollack is a former Georgia standout who saw his NFL career cut short because of injuries. 
While he has clearly carved out a nice career for himself on ESPN shows like College GameDay and College Football Live, apparently Pollack is interested in another calling. 
When it was announced that defensive line coach Tracy Rocker is no longer with the Georgia program, a fan kiddingly tweeted that Pollack would be the one to take over for Rocker in Athens. 
Below is Pollack's response. 
How'd you know that? Haha. It might happen but in 4-6 years. Coaching is in the plans for me. https://t.co/RY8uYkV6Gn â€” David Pollack (@davidpollack47) February 7, 2017 
So, not only is becoming a coach in Pollack's plans - it's in the fairly near future. In fact, he has already established a timeframe. File this in the back of your mind for when Pollack's ESPN contract is up and he is negotiating a new contract. 
Maybe he'll bolt to the coaching ranks if he doesn't get what he wants.
